marketNews.title: The Fed Holds Rates, Awaiting Tariff Developments
marketNews.content: The Fed on Wednesday (5/7) local time decided to maintain its benchmark interest rate in the range of 4.25-4.5%, in line with consensus expectations. This decision reflects a wait-and-see approach amid global uncertainty due to US tariffs, even though US President Donald Trump pressured The Fed to cut the benchmark interest rate immediately. Fed Chair Jerome Powell said that it is currently too early to determine whether inflation or unemployment will be the main risk going forward. Generally, the Fed noted that the US economy continues to expand with solid growth. Although initial forecasts showed US economic growth contracted by -0.3% on an annualized basis in 1Q25, the Fed attributed this to the surge in imports to anticipate tariffs. The Fed itself stated that the US labor market remains "solid" and inflation is still "quite high." Powell also added that the Fed does not need to rush in adjusting interest rates until there is further certainty regarding the direction of trade policy from the US government. The US government indeed appears quite inconsistent with its tariff policy, causing uncertainty. For example, a few days after announcing reciprocal tariffs, Trump decided to postpone the implementation of higher tariffs for 90 days to provide time for negotiation for affected countries, except China. At the end of this week, the US government will meet with the Chinese government in Switzerland, where Bloomberg reported that the meeting between the two countries will focus on de-escalating the trade war. The US financial market tended to be muted and moved mixed on Wednesday (5/7) following the Fed's decision and comments. The three US stock indices strengthened, with S&P 500 +0.43%, Nasdaq +0.27%, and DJIA +0.70%. Meanwhile, the DXY rose +0.45%, while the 10-year US government bond yield rose +4 bps to 4.31%. In Indonesia, the IHSG weakened -1.42% on Thursday (8/5), while the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield was relatively flat at 6.86% and the Rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar strengthened +0.25% to 16,495. Key Takeaway: The market still expects a Fed rate cut of 75 bps by the end of 2025, based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool as of Thursday (8/5). Developments in trade negotiations will be a factor influencing the Fed's interest rate outlook and need to be watched by investors. Besides the planned meeting with the Chinese government this weekend, the US government will also sign a trade agreement with the UK on Thursday (8/5) local time, marking the first agreement since Trump announced reciprocal tariffs.

tickerNews.title: GOTO States No Agreement Reached with Grab
tickerNews.content: GOTO GoTo Gojek Tokopedia stated in a clarification to the IDX regarding rumors of a transaction with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) that the company does receive offers from various parties from time to time. Nevertheless, GOTO affirms that the company has not reached any decision regarding offers that may have been known or received by the company. Previously, Reuters reported that Grab was seeking to reach an agreement to acquire GOTO in 2Q25.

tickerNews.title: ASII Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Payout
tickerNews.content: Astra International shareholders approved the plan for dividend distribution for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 16.4 trillion rupiah, equivalent to a 48% dividend payout ratio, indicating a final dividend of 308 rupiah per share with a final dividend yield of 6.4% as of Thursday (8/5). The cum date and payment date are not yet known. This final dividend amount is in line with management's proposal in February 2025. Previously, ASII had distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 98 rupiah per share in October 2024.

tickerNews.title: JSMR Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Distribution and New President Director
tickerNews.content: Jasa Marga shareholders approved the plan for dividend distribution for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 1.1 trillion rupiah or 156.23 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 25% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 3.9% as of Thursday (8/5). The cum date and payment date are not yet known. An earnings report and the appointment of a new President Director were also approved.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Completes Share Buyback for March-May 2025 Period
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina announced that it has completed the share buyback for the period of March 21 - May 2, 2025, with the number of shares purchased reaching approximately 83.2 million (0.54%) shares. The total transaction value reached approximately 99.3 billion rupiah or 1,196 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: INET Announces Fiber Optic Core Supply Cooperation and Plans Rights Issue for Business Expansion
tickerNews.content: Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima through its subsidiary, PT Pusat Fiber Indonesia, announced a fiber optic core supply cooperation worth 242.6 billion rupiah with PT Jejaring Mitra Persada. In a separate transaction, INET plans to hold a rights issue of up to 12.8 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 57.14%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the fund proceeds are intended for business development. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on June 12, 2025.

tickerNews.title: CSRA Targets IDR 1.25-1.3 Trillion Revenue in 2025, Postpones Dividend Due to Economic Anticipation
tickerNews.content: Director of Cisadane Sawit Raya, Seman Senjaja, stated that his party is targeting revenue to increase to around 1.25-1.3 trillion rupiah during 2025 (versus 2024 realization: ~1.1 trillion rupiah). This target will be supported by the operation of a new palm oil mill in Banyuasin, South Sumatra in June 2025, which is projected to increase the company's CPO production from 55,000 tons in 2024 to around 65,000-70,000 tons in 2025. On the other hand, Seman mentioned that CSRA will abstain from distributing dividends for the 2024 fiscal year because the company needs to anticipate a deteriorating economic situation and pay maturing debt.

tickerNews.title: CBUT Targets 35-40% YoY Revenue Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: President Director of Citra Borneo Utama, Ronny Hertantyo Raharjo, stated that his party is targeting revenue growth of approximately +35-40% YoY during 2025.

tickerNews.title: Other Hot News You Need to Know
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that foreign exchange reserves in April 2025 fell to 152.5 billion US dollars (vs. March 2025: 157.1 billion US dollars), marking the lowest level since November 2024. This decline was influenced by government external debt payments and Bank Indonesia's efforts to stabilize the Rupiah exchange rate amidst financial market uncertainty. The position of foreign exchange reserves in April 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.4 months of imports or 6.2 months of imports and government external debt payments. Head of Asia-Pacific Sovereigns at Fitch, Thomas Rookmaaker, stated on Wednesday (7/5) that Indonesia will face challenges in achieving 5% YoY economic growth in 2025 due to uncertainty from the global trade war and weakening consumer spending. Fitch itself has cut Indonesia's economic growth projection by -0.1 percentage point to +4.9% YoY in 2025, and forecasts growth in 2026 will only reach +4.7% YoY. Despite this, Rookmaaker mentioned that the slowing economic growth will not change Indonesia's rating, which currently holds a 'BBB' rating with a stable outlook from Fitch. The US Energy Information Administration noted that US crude oil stocks fell by 2 million barrels in the week ending May 2, 2025, exceeding consensus expectations which predicted a drawdown of 833,000 barrels. IDX Director, I Gede Nyoman Yetna, stated on Thursday (8/5) that there will be 2 lighthouse companies that will IPO on the Indonesian stock exchange during 2025. Yetna mentioned that these two companies operate in the energy and consumer sectors, although he did not specify their identities. The IDX itself notes that there are still 30 companies scheduled to IPO in 2025, 10 of which are companies with jumbo assets exceeding 250 billion rupiah. The IDX on Thursday (8/5) released 2 new regulations that serve as the legal basis for the implementation of liquidity provider activities to enhance stock market deepening and quality. As a note, the implementation of liquidity providers does not apply to all stocks on the IDX, where the IDX will issue a list of eligible stocks for liquidity providers every 6 months. The Director of Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES), Sugiyanto Wibawa, has submitted his resignation letter from his position on May 6, 2025. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on June 17, 2025.
